title: Stake In Ferrari Up For Grabs In US Flotation
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Jul 23, 2015, 12:49 BST - UK Markets close in 3 hrs 41 mins Stake In Ferrari Up For Grabs In US Flotation By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 5 minutes ago View Photo 

Ferrari is to be floated on the New York Stock Exchange, under plans to spin off the luxury car-maker. 
Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, which owns a 90% stake in Ferrari, announced the move in a submission to the US Securities and Exchange Commission. 
The filing said an initial public offering, expected in October, would contain more than 10% of the business. 
The rest of its stake would be distributed between existing Fiat Chrysler shareholders. 
The proceeds of the share sale would be used to help fund an investment plan at Fiat, aimed at boosting sales by 60% by 2018. 
Piero Ferrari, vice chairman and son of Ferrari's founder Enzo, owns the other 10% in the so-called 'prancing horse' - renowned for its trademark red sports cars and Formula One racing team. 
No further details were provided on the expected pricing but Ferrari chairman Sergio Marchionne believes Ferrari is worth at least €10bn (£7.1bn).
